content.description:
Start on a sloping jug at the lip of the boulder just to the right of the tree. Move up on small cobbles and nubbins to the top. The hardest part is getting established on slab above the overhang without hitting the tree.

 This could be done as a sit start on a good left-hand sidepull and a pretty bad right-hand crimp. It would be much harder (V5-6?), but that would make the climb better overall.
content.location: Enter Webster Conservation Area, walk past the large Pinnacle Boulder, and this problem is on the low, overhanging wall just under the big roof. The start is just to the right of the tree growing close to the far end of the wall.

content.description: Start using cluster of pockets just above head height. Move up right to good sloping knob, adjust feet, and move for the lip.
content.location:
This is on the long, 10-12 foot tall wall below the Eliminator Roof. Walk past the large Pinnacle Boulder, and look for the big roof on your right. This problem is towards the far end of the long low wall below this roof, just to the right of a tree growing close to the wall.

 There are a bunch of other good problems on this wall as well. Most start from the sloping rail feature near the right end of the wall.

content.description: Start with your hands on left end arete of Eliminator Boulder. (There is a big jug here that feels like it may break off, so that's off.) Traverse right on crimps and sharp open hand holds, and then top out about 2-3 feet before the tree on Tree Climb. The crux is turning the lip.
content.location: It ascends the left side of the Eliminator Boulder.

content.description: Stand start with your right in a small pocket, left at the bottom of the vertical seam and good feet.  Work up through the first lip and bridge the gap to the huge slab that rests above.  Mantle up through that face.
content.location: This is directly outside of the narrow "corridor" created by this problem's backside and upper slab. It is 3 feet to the right of 1 Route.

content.description: Sit start as for  1 Route , but move straight up to a jug with a good sloper next to it. Top out straight above the start.
content.location: This is on low, overhanging wall under large Eliminator roof.

content.description: Sit start on far left of low sloping rail. Move up and right on slopers and good crimps. Make a long move for a good sloping jug at the lip. Top out straight up or to the right (both about the same difficulty), or go for easier topout by traversing back left.
content.location: Enter Webster Conservation Area, walk past large, Pinnacle Boulder. This problem is on the low, overhanging wall below the large roof. This problem starts on the obvious rail feature on the near side of the wall.

content.description:
This is a wide, 10-12 foot bouldering wall below the Eliminator Roof area.

 The GPS setting is not correct yet.

 L->R:

 A.  Tree Climb, V2, 12'. B.  Pocket Cluster, V1-2, 10'. C1. 2 Route , V1, 10'. C2.  1 Route , V2+, 12'. D. 3 Route, V0, 10'.
